results.title: Operations Lead
results.description:
About Swing Left

Swing Left is a national grassroots organization working to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. We make it possible for anyone to make an impact on the elections that determine the balance of power in our country, by volunteering in and donating to key races. Since launching in 2017, Swing Left volunteers have raised $80 million for Democratic candidates, civic organizations, and voter mobilization efforts, and made more than 44 million combined phone calls, door knocks, and letters sent to voters via our affiliate Vote Forward and their partners.

About Vote Forward

Vote Forward is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit organization that builds tools to encourage Americans to vote. We work to increase the participation of traditionally underrepresented groups in the electorate, and to increase civic engagement among the public at large, by supporting the volunteers working to engage these voters. Since 2018, more than 250,000 grassroots volunteers have used the Vote Forward platform to send handwritten letters to more than 25 million prospective voters to encourage them to register to vote and turn out for elections. Vote Forward is closely affiliated with Swing Left, and Vote Forward staff work with Swing Left on many projects of mutual interest.

Overview

The objective of the Operations Lead is to ensure ongoing operational functionality and effective budget management, and a workplace that is equitable, sustainable, effective, and engaged, by leading financial, compliance, legal, administrative, and people programs for Swing Left and Vote Forward. This role reports to the Managing Director and is an at-will position.

We aim to begin interviews for this position by early February. We expect to review the first batch of applications by January 20 and then will do a rolling review of applications until the position is filled and/or the application is closed. Please note that our office is closed between December 17 ‚Äì January 2.

Responsibilities¬†

Lead the development and implementation of financial, accounting, compliance, legal, and operational procedures and programs to ensure the organizations' ongoing financial health and compliance¬†

  • Lead the development and implementation of simple and accurate financial, accounting and budget policies and processes to ensure effective, efficient, and well-informed resource allocation and budget decisions by the Executive Director, and to ensure adherence to financial programs for tracking and reporting purposes¬†
  • Lead the development and implementation of financial compliance and legal procedures for the organization and ensure efficient communication of and cross-functional adherence to these procedures; identify and implement improvements and updates to current processes to increase effectiveness and efficiency¬†
  • Lead the processes to procure, assess, audit and implement the virtual office tools and employee resources needed to run the organization effectively and team members are set up for success to do the work required of their position and meet the needs of the organization¬†
  • Lead the execution of financial health reporting to the executive team

Oversee the development, implementation, and execution of people programs and initiatives to ensure an effective, engaged, diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce¬†

  • Oversee the development, implementation, and execution of people programs, including position development, hiring, onboarding, employee retention, internships, and offboarding, to ensure these programs are effective and equitable, meet legal requirements, and follow HR best practices
  • Review and approve position descriptions, compensation, and other employment requirements to ensure programs and processes are applied consistently and equitably across employees¬†
  • Lead the development and execution of feedback and employee development initiatives, including management training for supervisors, performance evaluations, and employee engagement surveys

Serve as a member of the organization's leadership team: collaborate with other leadership team members and executive leadership to analyze feedback from staff, identify areas of improvement, establish org-wide priorities and programs, and coordinate to ensure the success of cross-functional initiatives

Successful Operations Lead candidates will have
  • A strong commitment to Swing Left's mission and values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; the demonstrated ability to provide outstanding customer service via written and verbal communication
  • Extensive knowledge on financial analysis, including demonstrated experience with managing an organizational budget, a strong understanding of accounting systems, and a command of Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues, and a strong solutions orientation
  • Experience and familiarity with the legal and compliance landscape of election-related activities and for 501(c)(4) organizations
  • Experience with people operations and general HR practices a must; additional experience with DEIB (diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging) work, talent recruitment and employee retention strongly preferred
  • Demonstrated success managing and leading staff and building an impact-driven, collaborative team culture
  • A keen interest in being an intentional organizational leader, trusted thought partner to executive leadership, and critical individual contributor¬†
  • A demonstrated commitment to equity and belonging across all identities including but not limited to race, gender, sexual orientation, age and ability. A specific track record of a commitment to BIPOC communities
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively across teams in a remote environment
Working at Swing Left

The Operations Lead position is a full-time, exempt and remote position. The pay range for this position is $110,000 - $125,000 on an annualized basis. We provide cost of living compensation increases at the beginning of each year.¬†

In addition to health, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, Swing Left's benefits package includes a professional development fund, a remote work fund, and a technology stipend for all employees. We have an unlimited time-off policy, a flexible medical and parental leave policy, and our office is closed for approximately 25 business days each year. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our benefits and policies in interviews.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek applications from all qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time.¬†

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, citizenship, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy status, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other differences.

Please note the best way to express interest in this position is to submit an application‚Äì‚Äìthis is the most effective way for our team to review and process applications fairly and efficiently.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Fuel50 are leaders in the space of career discovery and mobility within organisations and have pioneered our way there using ML and AI at the core of our product strategy. This is an opportunity to join a company who are building products that transform the people experience and who are fully bought in to the value that great product design contributes to their success.

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Product team. Reporting to the Design Lead, you will be working closely with a Product Manager as well as our Engineering team and together you will own a part of Fuel50, ship solutions to challenging problems and get feedback directly from our customers.

Being successful in this role will see you work across the spectrum of product design, from quickly creating sketches and prototypes to shape solutions to problems, or running user research alongside your team‚Äôs product manager, to taking these insights through ideation into shipped product with your product development team.

The ideal candidate for this role will thrive in a small team where you can make a big impact. You are confident in your toolkit and experience, and you also love to pick up new skills and knowledge. In addition, you have an innate drive to be successful. As a foundational member of a scaling start-up, you want to take the initiative and solve big problems.

Key Role Responsibilities:

  • Act as a leader within your product squad, collaborating to make your work and the whole team thrive.
  • Work through design problems from beginning to end, often partnering with designers on other teams to create holistic experiences.
  • Sketch and prototype ideas to quickly assess viability and make design directions clear and concrete for the whole team, helping the team to make better decisions.
  • Iterate your designs based on testing and feedback from our customers and from the whole team.
  • Facilitate design-thinking and problem-solving within your Product Squad and between this team and the other product, go-to-market and customer success teams they partner with.
  • Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.
  • Own the success or failure of your design work and initiate design sprints to innovate or improve upon shipped work.

Requirements

  • Experienced in designing digital products and systems, not just websites. You have helped ship digital products.
  • Design connected modular systems, not just disparate user interfaces.
  • Have a strong service design mentality and understand the broader landscape of the product and impact that your work can bring.
  • Being able to prototype to learn and are comfortable choosing and using the right level of fidelity, from simple sketches to high-fidelity functional prototypes in Figma, Sketch, etc.
  • Have a strong appreciation of the entire product development process, and can take a concept from a whiteboard sketch, through to a fully-realised user experience with detailed UI.
  • You have the ability to create prototypes using Framer, Keynote, HTML/CSS/JS, etc.
  • Strong understanding of quantitative data and are comfortable working alongside product managers and UX researchers in refining your design work.
  • Excellent communicator of design work and the rationale behind proposals.
  • You are adept at coordinating work across multiple teams and bringing together ideas from various stakeholder groups, both in and out of R&D.
  • Previous experience working on products that incorporated ML or AI elements would be advantageous.

About Fuel50

Fuel50 is an international, high-growth tech company. Our award-winning AI talent marketplace platform exists to improve the lives and careers of people everywhere by empowering forward-thinking companies to deploy career growth and talent mobility initiatives to attract and retain talent while boosting engagement and productivity. In other words, we are at the forefront of changing how people work and how organizations empower their people.

Our tech is global and has touched careers across 100+ companies in 13+ languages and 25+ countries. Our clients are some of the biggest brands in their respective industries. And, most importantly, we practice what we preach and believe everyone should be in a job they love (including you!).

Fuel50 is immensely proud of our strong team culture, where our people (or ‚ÄúFuellies‚Äù) come first. Our vision and values are inclusive and transparent and built upon quarterly business objectives that drive our growth, encourage goal setting, and celebrate milestones every step of the way.

The Fuel50 vision has resonated with investors across NZ, Australia, UK, and the USA - supporting our global growth and helping us become the pioneers in this fast-growing talent space.

We are also a socially responsible company. We work with charities that help women and minority groups land on their feet through career coaching and support.

Benefits

As well as our day-to-day responsibilities, all Fuellies play an integral part in growing our culture with us and ensuring that Fuel50 remains an inspirational and amazing place to work. Some additional benefits are:

  • Day off on your birthday, your Fuel50 anniversary and a companywide celebration day.
  • Employee Stock Options Plan (ESOP).
  • Flexible working times and remote working (as above) - we're very supportive of school commitments, traveling in off-peak hours, looking after the kids, and all that jazz.
  • Investing in you with career and development planning, using our very own Fuel50 software and online Fuellie University.
  • A very progressive parental leave policy - get extra flexibility and time off on top of what your local government already mandates.
  • Comprehensive fully subsidised Health Insurance with Southern Cross.
  • Family and friends pizza nights once a month (if you live nearby HQ) - bring your best mate, significant other, kids, or yourself for pizza, table tennis, and pool.

What is it like to be a Fuellie?

We know that having the right people with the right attitude and behavior is a big part of what makes us successful. Living our values is an important part of being successful in this role.

  • We have a culture around continuous (but super friendly) feedback and recognition - be part of a family-like team that is working towards a common goal and helping each other every step of the way.
  • We have #SuperheroAwards at every quarterly sprint meeting and every weekly team meeting includes spontaneous recognition and shout-outs across the business.
  • We'll have your back when you need help - your colleagues want to see you succeed and work hard to help you do so.
  • We work hard and deliver amazing results to our clients - when you see our amazing feedback, you'll be proud to be a Fuellie.
  • Amazing coffee - it really is, some of our team have even come to HQ on a Saturday just to get their fix!

Application Process

If this sounds like you, then please apply. If you‚Äôre not sure you're ready or perhaps you don't meet all requirements yet, please apply anyway. We'll review every application that we get.

Applications close on Sunday 11 December

This role is based in New Zealand, as a result candidates must hold the relevant right to work in NZ i.e. Citizenship or a work visa at time of application.

¬†

Location üåç

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

results.title: Software Release Manager

results.title: Senior Data Scientist
results.description:
Company Description

https://qumata.com/

Qumata: A New Standard for Life and Health Insurance Underwriting

Be part of the Tech and Data transformation of an entire sector from its core. We need you to help scale up a pioneer and write history.

Qumata unlocks insights into an individual‚Äôs current and future health and mortality risks, for anyone equipped with a smartphone, instantaneously and without medical questionnaires or examinations. We work with life and health insurers to help them create a faster, more customer-centric underwriting journey, providing the extra-mortality, extra-morbidity and other parameters for any individual and for 800 medical conditions.

  • Founded 2017
  • Extension of Series A funding to $23m
  • Named one of Forbes‚Äô ‚Äú20 Tech-For-Social-Good Startups To Watch‚Äù in 2020
  • Named in Insurtech100 2021 and awarded "Most Innovative Insurtech" by Garmin Health¬†
  • Over 50 employees globally¬†
  • A team of 7 in Data Science Department

You will help us revolutionise this industry with a range of clients and partners from small to top-tier Insurers, re-insurers, and MGAs in Europe and APAC.



Job Description

As a Data Scientist at Qumata, you would be supporting the development of our insurance products and leading the transformation of insurance worldwide. The role will require you to push forward the effort to replace the standard life and health insurance questionnaires with Qumata's low friction, data driven process built around the models developed by the data science team.

You will develop the capability and business knowledge, along with the technical skills required to design and implement insightful and engaging data driven solutions for our clients.¬† ¬† You will work to improve upon and develop new model features and output so the team can deliver the best possible products for our clients.¬†

Responsibilities:

results.title: Ruby Backend Developer
results.description:
We are seeking an experienced Ruby backend developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable and maintainable backend systems using Ruby and related technologies.

Wolf SaaS marketplaces have helped 200,000+ job seekers find flexible work in their communities, while helping over 7,000 hospitals, restaurants, and families find the nurses, servers, and babysitters they need. As part of our mission to launch the next 1,000 talent marketplaces, we're looking for a backend engineer with experience in Ruby to optimize our system development and performance.

We're recent Techstars alumni, having just gone through the Techstars Anywhere 2022 program and just closed our seed round. Our fully remote, multicultural team has employees in 3 countries and is growing fast!

What you bring to the table:

  • 3+ years of professional experience as a backend developer
  • Strong proficiency in Ruby and related technologies (e.g. Rails)
  • Experience with REST APIs and microservices
  • Experience with database design and SQL
  • Experience with Git and version control
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (preferred)

What you'll be doing:

  • Design and implement scalable and maintainable backend systems using Ruby and related technologies
  • Collaborate with the product and design teams to understand requirements and develop solutions
  • Write clean, well-documented code that follows best practices
  • Participate in code reviews and ensure that all team members are following best practices
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools

Would be a plus:

  • Experience or interest in SaaS or HR/Staffing softwares
  • Knowledge of on-demand staffing industry or talent marketplaces

What we offer:

  • Ability to work remotely
  • Employee stock options and annual performance bonuses
  • Opportunity to learn exciting new skills and grow your career
